featured.text: Named “Velcro,” from the French words velours (velvet) and crochet (hook), the new product received a patent from the Swiss government in 1955.

definition.zh_def: 一種柔軟的絨面布料，通常用於服裝和家居裝飾。
definition.en_def: A soft fabric with a velvety texture, often used in clothing and upholstery.
definition.example: She wore a beautiful velour dress to the party.
